alert.note: Alert for Burlington; Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 25 at 7:48PM EDT until July 25 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey...including the following counties...Atlantic, Burlington, and Ocean. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 748 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Atlantic City, Pleasantville, Ventnor City, Brigantine, Northfield, Absecon, Egg Harbor City, Tuckerton, Weymouth, Estell Manor, Port Republic, and Pomona. - This includes the following highways... Garden State Parkway between mile markers 33 and 50. Atlantic City Expressway between mile markers 0 and 20. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
